WRITING.TEXT:
im getting married 2 weeks after you. i dont even have my dress yet to GET altered, it isnt due to come in until september. FH also has not gone for his tux. we havent even put a thought to up lighting hah! and my makeup trial is only next week.
I think we're OK!

It works out because they really are the only kids in both our families. So its not like opening up to children means having like 20 of them running around. We are putting them at their own table, right next to their parents. Whats funny is my FMIL at first seemed against them even coming; she gave me the "well its yoooour wedding" response and i basically put my foot down and said yes, it is, and they are invited! it seems you are damned if you do and damned if you dont sometimes!

So im not a parent, but we're having kids at our wedding, because my cousins on my moms side are all much, much younger than me and i am very close to them. I am 30, the eldest is 14 (of 8 of them!). Her brothers got married and had kids much later than my parents did. Anyway, they look up to me, i see them 3+ times a year, and i couldnt imagine not having them there. We're really close and i love them all dearly!
That's really, really awesome they were willing to work with you on this! i love the new dress!
nope. nope nope nope nope.
i am not including one. there are directions on my website, but like you said otherwise, its 2017. GPS is a thing. its definitely not mandatory.
Not quite yet at that time. It can be anywhere from 40s to 50s in NYC and while we've had snow a couple of years in november, it's pretty rare. it doesnt hit us until late Dec or even January.
looove! i tried this one on, it was so lovely and really comfy! looks amazing on you especially with the added belt!
woo November brides! we will be exactly 6 months away on Thursday and i can't believe it!
We're also going to Thailiand, and Cambodia! Can you let me know which resort you are staying in, in Phuket? we are planning 3 nights there.

Dealing with the same, with drapery rentals. We have 2 that were on the venue's list, so we reached out to both for quotes as we have no idea what it'll cost. It's been over a week, almost 2, and nothing from either.
1695 was the tag price. with shipping, its 1895. i havent received it yet, so i dont know what alterations will be.

I bought my jewelry off Etsy. here's my [headband](https://www.etsy.com/listing/270740719/rhinestone-crystal-pearl-bridal-headband?ref=shop_home_active_6) and here's my [necklace](https://www.etsy.com/listing/270357584/backdrop-bridal-necklace-back-drop?ref=shop_home_active_20). I still don't know what im doing in terms of anything else (i dont have pierced ears so i dont know if im doing clip ons or just nothing).

ah ok! it looks a lot like my Essense of Australia, which is the d2000 (except i guess the band across the waist is pretty different, plus the train is shorter on this one). [for reference](https://www.essensedesigns.com/essense-of-australia/wedding-dresses/d2000/)
a little less, and just more blended in. right now it just looks like it was blotted on your cheeks, not that it was blended in to the rest of the look.
I feel like the blush is a little harsh to me, like it needs to be blended in more. I love everything else though!
That looks A LOT like my dress, love it! is it essense of australia?
I'm in NYC. i was asked by my best friend literally in person over lunch. no gift or card or anything. I just sent out cards, no boxes, no extras.

My wedding is the day before my birthday this year. We're very excited about it; FH sees it as, he'll never forget either date ever again ;) and we're going to do a countdown at midnight and play Beatles - Birthday as the last song to celebrate my 31st! Someone asked me if i think the wedding anniversary will "Take away" from my birthday. i said hell no, it'll just make those 2 days so epic every year!

My dad is paying for a chunk, my FH's parents are paying for everything else. Aside from a few people the ywanted to invite, which we agreed on upfront, they are not weighing in on anything. ive picked all the vendors, they say "Cool, we trust you." i have made 90% of decisions on my own with FH, and 10% with others only when i needed help. FH's parents aren't like "Well we're paying why arent they doing what we want?" because they see it as a gift. and im SUPER grateful for it, now that i see some others see it as a place to make the wedding aobut them.
i agree. i see how it means they can have some input, but in the end i still feel like final decision comes down to the couple. i know thats not popular opinion, but thats how i feel.

everything from what kind of mood we want (funny? intimate? serious? etc) to if we want to honor anyone specifically in the family or who has passed, are we religious or not, to how we met, fell in love, what do we love most about each other etc. we fill it out separately, so she gets 2 versions and then puts that together to tell our story.
was going to say the same! It's really not your responsibility. Especially since you made it clear on the website it was a no-kid wedding. Side note, DisneyBounder, love your name ;)
Holy balls, that means im 6 months and 1 week away haha oh lord!
our budget is around the same, maybe 75k tops. Also in NYC.

Not that much. A lot of them after i booked them let me know when we'd need to check in again. The DJ, for instance, will be checking in 7 weeks prior and we'll be having one last in person meeting around then. The florist will be checking in about 3 months before. Our officiant sent us a questionnaire to fill out for our ceremony, but we don't have to return that until June, so we haven't heard a peep in between yet. I dont find a need to check in unless i have a specific question! I will be checking in with the caterer in a few weeks to see where we are at with cake offerings (she works with an outside company) but otherwise im not regularly sending emails or anything.

the downside is that it's a lot of rooms and up and down stairs (there is one elevator for the older folk, but because it was built back then it's small!). But thats the trade off for not being in a hotel with a bigger ballroom space.
Damn girl, you've got good genes! you and mom look amazing! Would love to hear more details overall!
thats insane, a filling is such a basic procedure! im so sorry this happened to you!

I always love new Disney best friends!!! Soarin' is an awesome idea too! Yeah, i wanted songs not everyone would recognize. Oh, we're also throwing in a song from main street for pre-ceremony! [This one](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=rqEJTqDv2j0)
OK, i feel like a real dick if she IS dead, but man im skeptical.

Oh, this is my speciality! I am a huge Disney World nerd, specifically the parks but also love and grew up with the movies. FH hates it haha but, he knows how important it is to me (like, i went there 3x this year, my first trip i was 2 years old, etc etc). SO. Pre ceremony music is a mix of piano/violin renditions of I See the Light, Second Star to the Right, Feed the Birds, Ma Belle Evangeline, as well as direct from movies, Married Life from Up, Define Dancing from Wall-E. Some of these instrumental versions are actually taken from Club 33, the special club in Disneyland.
Cocktail hour? The entire Tower of Terror hour long loop. It's all classic 1920s and 30s jazz anyway, so it fits right in with our venue, my FH loves it, and no one will be the wiser except my fellow Disney World geek friends.
Oh, im also walking down the aisle to a softer violin rendition of Princess Leia's theme, which i guess now is "Disney" ha.

Exactly; they often say "what are we going to do with all this money when we aren't here anymore? we might as well spend it during our time together and make it special." and i totally understand that.

I'm sure! And even though I'm used to NYC being expensive, ive still always been fairly frugal. Grew up in a blue collar family; my dad worked steel work in the city for 30 years (and built some amazing buildings here!) but even though he's doing very well in retirement, we were never my FH's family's level of "doing well". So the cost is cringey even to me and i felt weird typing it out haha but i wanted to just be a realist about how much it costs in these big cities.
lol I promise i will!
Oh i love it though! super classy! mine is [The Pratt House](http://www.pratthouse.com/)
whats your venue name, if you dont mind? Im so intrigued since ours sound similar!
no, not rude! NYC is insane haha i was born raised here. MY shock is always how cheap everywhere else is
to put it in perspective, while that IS expensive, most caterers in NYC run 25-35k.
no theme. venue was built in 1919. so, we're embracing the 1920s of it. But its not "themed" that way or i fear it'd seem like a gastby party or something.
believe it or not, old navy. Ive tried a few diff brands. the other ones got holes quickly or stretched. old navys no shows are still going strong!
feel free to use it, not like i have a monopoly on it ;)
have you tried those really low cut socks for flats? theyve literally changed my life.
They CAN have them, like the places ive looked offer it, but i dont think its standard. I never had one as a bridesmaid.
yup, this. 3 choices + veggie is what we're doing (chicken, beef, fish as the other options).
I LOVE s'mores, but wine. Every time.

Yup i got mine through etsy! My dress is pretty detailed so i knew i needed something simpler for jewelry. Im pretty decisive on stuff like that though. Let me know if you want any reccos of where to look!

For me its like, ESPECIALLY if you are invited to the wedding, im not going to show you! i want it to be a surprise! My bridesmaids/men have seen it, my dads seen it, my FMIL has seen it. Thats it and thats how i want it!

Ok, so, real talk. I feel very guilty about how expensive my wedding is, and im not even paying for it. FH's parents are wealthy, and they see spending money on taking us on vacation, experiences, and this wedding as a "tax free transfer of wealth" as his dad puts it. I know they have the money to do it, but i still feel so much guilt about how expensive its becoming, especially that we're in NYC. I will say that our catering alone is 44k. Yeah. Its insane. But his parents wanted "The best" and are eager to spend the money. And im sitting here like... im going to have this fabulous wedding and im excited... and also like... im going to have this fabulous wedding and it's a waste. But in the end i know THEY dont see it as a waste, they see it as a gift. So i just keep reminding myself of that. But, you aren't alone.

gooot it! I think i read it wrong at first!

see, i disagree. i live and have grown up in NYC, and every wedding i go to, when i buy within the month, im too late. I get left with all the lower, meh gifts on the registry because everything has been bought already.

I wonder if this is a geographical thing? Ive always been "lazy" and bought gifts within the month...and then i find EVERYTHING has been bought. so ive learned if i want to get any of the non-napkin gifts haha, i better buy 2-3 months out. Because everything is always bought already!

I'm paying for all hair and makeup, however they are paying for their dresses and any accessories. I figure it's the least i can do to offset costs for them. However, i don't think there's anything wrong with asking around "Who wants to get hair and makeup done?" they might find that doing it themselves is more cost efficient. or maybe they want makeup and not hair. give them some options.
haha i totally respect that! Hey, different strokes for different folks :)
Every time i hear someone get a dress early i think.. LET THAT BE ME! RUB YOUR LUCK OFF ON ME! :P this is so exciting!!!

Do you mind if i ask you how old you are? You keep bringing up "your age group" but i feel like that's a little bit of a generalization. My FH's parents are in their 60s, and use Facebook Twitter quite a lot and enjoy it. And statistically, the older generation is the biggest growing audience on social as years go by.

Hi, social media strategist here! Hashtags are essentially search terms. Come up with an "ownable" one, meaning no one else uses it so it won't get mixed in with random other stuff, and then when someone (or you) search that hashtag in, say, instagram, you'll find all photos tagged with it. It's an awesome way for a couple to see all of the photos people may have taken of the event after the fact. Also as a way to just, document the planning process (ive used my own hashtag in a few instagrams already!).
I love Dig Inn, awesome idea for cheaper catering! You nailed it on budget, thats so hard to do here!
Yeah true, but we factored that in and are ok with it!

if it makes you feel better... or caterer is costing us about 3x the cost of our venue... yaaay NYC!
You don't HAVE to use a caterer. So many people, especially on this board alone, do the food themselves! Don't feel the pressure. Maybe you DO talk to your mom and say "hey, i totally understand that catering is easier, but it's not within our budget at all." maybe, just maybe she'll offer some money? If not, then she has to deal with the fact that this is where you stand on it.

im doing both. on the back of the invite with a ton of other info, we say "Please RSVP on our wedding website (link) or by mail. Do one or the other, you do not need to do both!" we have plenty of older folks who will never touch a site, but my friends will probably RSVP much faster through it.

I am! Im a social media strategist/consultant... if i didn't make one, i don't know who I'd be! haha. They are really cheap, surprisingly, though just an FYI to those doing it, cost is going to depend on location. If you're in Ohio? hella cheap. For me, in NYC? probably not so much.

do you mind if i ask around how much it cost you?

I wore underwear and a strapless bra, and the was asked to take off my bra to try on dresses since even with a strapless, a lot of the times the bra took away from what the look was supposed to be. omg, i love the back. that. is. amazing.

we're doing a memorial table that will include FH's grandparents, my grandfather, and my mother. We are specifically letting our officiant take a moment of the ceremony to talk about my mother because that's just something that will hang over the room, and we'd love to just honor her, and how much influence she's had on me, and how much she would've loved my FH. We're also saving her a seat with a bouquet of flowers, but that won't really be noticeable to anyone but immediate family.
same! i binge listen during gym workouts.

So, i like juice cleanses, but not to lose weight (yes i do lose weight but its not my goal). I do short, 3-5 day ones, and it just kind of...resets me. Like, it gets me in a great mindset to continue to eat well after the fact. i also really enjoy the taste of them, even the green ones haha.

I track macros, but i dont beat myself up on them ( i have a really hard time hitting my protein goals every day but if i hit 75% im still pretty happy with myself!). In tracking food my app auto tracks calories, but i dont pay attention to them. I havent weighed myself in months, as i stepped on a scale and gained 4lbs in muscle, and KNEW it was muscle but still let it make me feel guilty. That's when i said F the scale. I think about what i eat, i make purposeful food choices, but i do not meal prep or anything like that. Im pretty happy for it.

I didn't get a "feeling." I tried it on, and i thought, wow this looks awesome! But then i walked away and tried on dresses at another place 3 weeks later, and equally thought "wow this looks awesome!" to ANOTHER dress. Then went back to try on the first, and had to decide between the two and it was TOUGH. no "Feeling" no "this is the one" just... flip a coin almost haha.
I too am considering mixed metals. I have a platinum engagement ring but i ADORE rose gold, so was considering it for the wedding band.

how high of a dosage are you on? I take 10mg of lexapro for my IBS (which is stress/anxiety induced) but i can drink just fine, however, 10mg is a low dose.
In terms of getting off meds to avoid side effects, unfortunately it takes more than a week to get any antidepressant out of your system. Was on Wellubtrin long ago and it took at least 2 weeks to get it fully out of my system and then i was hit with really bad withdrawl symptoms. So, i know you already know to talk to your doc, but i really do advise it.
OMG i want to literally put that on our wedding website. "Cab it, bus it, walk it. Fuck it." im dying!

I have to do everything in my power to not just print out and drop a checklist on his desk so he knows everything we STILL have to do.

WRITING.TITLE: NYC Hair Makeup For $1500ish
WRITING.TEXT:
Does anyone have any recommendations in hair and makeup vendors? I was in talks with one for an exchange of services (I work in social media, their social media could be better) but they have really dropped the ball on pushing forward with working together, so now im covering my ass and searching to just pay for someone else.
It is only myself, my MOH and 2 bridesmaids (the other 2 on my side are men, and all of FH's side are men!).
So essentially, 4 women, and im looking to spend like, 1k-1500 tops. Any recommendations?

that does sound manipulative, if only because you did everything in your power to work with them, to figure out a budget, and they kept telling you "not to worry about it" and yet, it was an issue. That's them not properly communicating. That kind of thing drives up a WALL. Im sorry youve dealt with this.

We aren't doing a shuttle... our venue is in manhattan. Take a cab. The hotels we chose are like, less than 10 blocks away, a 5 min ride, the cab ride will NOT be expensive. My friends are literally taking the subway (though to be fair, we all live here, some born and raised here, so subway-ing in fancy clothes is par for the course).
I totally feel you. You don't NEED to provide transportation.
That's exactly how my best friend did it, they both were walked down after we, the bridal party, walked in. and it was great!

They called people idiots etc. It was insane!
they are out of my size on all the styles i like for rehearsal dinner :( but i hope someone else finds something great!

(to be honest, the wording on invitations really doesnt matter to me though. i never read invites, i look at the date, i fill out the RSVP, thats about it).
Only the people who specifically click through the link you've shared can see it, so, everyone here, but not the random public trolls of imgur!

Those two lines are separate, but i understand what you're saying. But maybe it sounds weird...
You look stunning! Also side note i recommend you make sure your image is private... or you invite stupid imgur trolls to comment! But really, im in love with this dress!

Since both parents are helping to pay, we didn't want to call out names. "Together with their families" didn't fit well in my design so we shortened it to "along with our families".
The back of the invitation has a buttload of info. The RSVP is really simple "Kindly Reply by October 21st" with the M______ space and then accepts, regrets. we don't need to take meal info ahead of time.

We got an awesome suite for the night before and the night of the wedding, a few blocks from the venue. If anyone has something to say about it, ill bop em on the nose! Don't let it get to you, its literally the TINIEST thing and a very old tradition.

Ours will be at different tables, but because FH's parents have out of town folks coming that don't know anyone, and they want to sit with them to make the more comfy. And that filled a 10 person table so, my dad and his wife will be sitting with cousins from his side!

WRITING.TITLE: Does Azazie Restock Samples Quickly?
WRITING.TEXT: My MOH loves the Claudia dress from them; she was able to get 2 other sample dresses but of course, this is the one she loves the most. Yesterday they only had a size 22 left, and now they have nothing (she needs a 12). How often or quickly do their samples come back in stock, and is there anyway to easily track this or do i have to manually check every day? I was going to just order it for her as soon as something came in in a 12 or even a 10 or 14 so she could see the style on.
I remember one was a jalapeno mojito. The other was def a bourbon drink, but i cant off the top of my head remember what was in it!
I'd say roughly... 120-130. And aah don't say that! I live here and am getting married here and hope no one overpromises and undelivers for my wedding! haha

WRITING.TITLE: Wedding Guest Perspective, NYC Hotel - Oct, 2016
WRITING.TEXT:
I first want to state i promise in no way to be condescending or insult a couple and their wedding! Ill be as straight forward as possible. I know some people don't like these threads, but I find them really interesting and helpful! Anyway, to the wedding!
This was a wedding at a new hotel in Brooklyn, friend of my fiance's (and her parents are friends with his parents, close knit group).
The Good
* The ceremony was held on a rooftop portion of the hotel and it was beautiful! The weather was nice and they had heating lamps which helped when it got a little chilly towards the end. * The food was delicious, and I was a big fan of their signature cocktails. * The couple were so, so lovely and the family was so amazingly supportive. They are a gay couple, and for one half this is the first and only woman she's ever been with, so to see the love and support from her family who were overall "new" to the idea was awesome. * The DJ was great and had people pretty much on the floor all night!
The Bad
* Because the couple booked the venue before it was actually complete (as in, the hotel was still being built and hadnt opened), the specs didn't exactly size out to the number of guests they had, despite what they were promised. we were very cramped in the cocktail hour space, uncomfortably so, and we waited 30 minutes in a very smushed line for a drink. The dance floor was also too small, people were shoulder to shoulder like a packed concert. This is not the fault of the couple, it's more the fault of the venue overpromising and underdelivering when it was finished. So just a good learning that if you are looking to book a venue that isn't complete, make sure it really ends up the size you need.
* Because it was one of the first weddings the venue had ever done, being brand new, the staff left much to be desired. They had no idea where they were going when placing food, some tables got fed way later than others, and you could tell they were a bit..distressed handling the situation. Same with the bartenders at cocktail hour, they were just overwhelmed with the amount of people and the small space. I felt for them, because when its the first wedding or one of the firsts you ever do, it's gotta be tough.
* They had a friend officiate and she was.. OK. Her nerves made her talk too quickly at times and it was hard to understand what she was saying so i missed a few bits of the ceremony.
That's pretty much it! I just wanted to put out there to make sure you've got a team and a venue that's ready to handle you, even if they are new! Overall though I had a good time, because I mean, i always have a good time at weddings!

one. i think the second makes you look a bit...well, matronly. its the sleeves and the top in general. I dont think its giving that old school hollywood vibe unfortunately. The first one looks BEAUTIFUL on you, though. Like, take a step back, wow, kind of beautiful!
